message:
I describe await semantics here: [https://blog.stephencleary....](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/02/async-and-await.html "https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/02/async-and-await.html")

You are correct in that Console and Win32 service apps (by default) will resume on the thread pool. There is no SynchronizationContext in this case.

Regarding deadlocks, the common sync-over-async deadlock will not occur ( [http://blog.stephencleary.c...](http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/07/dont-block-on-async-code.html "http://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/07/dont-block-on-async-code.html") ), but there are other deadlocks that can happen: [https://blog.stephencleary....](https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/12/dont-block-in-asynchronous-code.html "https://blog.stephencleary.com/2012/12/dont-block-in-asynchronous-code.html")
